title: Creepy photos capture a crumbling asylum in Wales where 1,500 patients were once housed and some had forced lobotomies
text:
Mrs Crunch House of Horrors Creepy photos capture a crumbling asylum in Wales where 1,500 patients were once housed and some had forced lobotomies 
The former hospital in Denbigh closed in 1995 By Alison Maloney Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CREEPY pictures have revealed the crumbling remains of an abandoned asylum where patients were once caged and given lobotomies. 
Graffiti strewn walls, collapsed roofs and rickety staircases are seen in the spooky images of Denbigh Asylum, in Wales, which once housed 1500 inmates. Media Drum World 14 Denbigh Asylum was closed in 1995 and has been crumbling ever since 
Between 1942 and 1944, more than 20 patients had prefrontal lobotomies – where part of the brain is removed as a treatment for insanity – and one died during the barbaric op. 
The listed building, designed by architect Thomas Full James, was built in 1848 but was designated for closure by MP Enoch Powell in 1960 and finally closed in 1995. 
In 2011, the local council spent £939,000 to stop the building collapsing and in 2013 a compulsory purchase order was served on the building. 
Ownership has yet to be transferred to the council and the site remains derelict.
